title: Relationships between democracy measures
text: Consider first dichotomous measures democracy, classify countries two categories: democracies non-democracies. highly correlated (median pairwise correlation coefficient = 0.84).   Nevertheless, measures poorly correlated rest, particular, PIPE (Przeworski 2013) bnr (Bernhard, Nordstrom, Reenock 2001) measures. PIPE measure democracy likely properly constructed; clear instructions replicating original documentation, can’t sure succeeded replicating . bnr measure different dichotomous measures democracy constructed survival analysis mind, hence includes democracies; extended non-democracies (bnr_extended) well-correlated rest. utip (Hsu 2008) doorenspleet (Doorenspleet 2000) also average correlations measures; somewhat idiosyncratic measures widely used, doorenspleet particular based earlier version Polity (Polity III) also adds “inclusion” criterion, whereas dichotomous measures based pacl (Cheibub, Gandhi, Vreeland 2009).

text: median correlation coefficient two measures (type) 0.83.  simple hierarchical cluster analysis can help us better visualize relationships among measures. top figure , find main outlier, measure democracy PIPE (Przeworski 2013). next cluster includes set continous measures, mostly V-Dem (Coppedge et al. 2025), also vanhanen measure (Vanhanen 2019) includes information participation. “thicker” measures democracy. bottom two clusters, contrast, contain measures derived pacl (Cheibub, Gandhi, Vreeland 2009), including bmr (Boix, Miller, Rosato 2012), gwf (Geddes, Wright, Frantz 2014) recent update pacl, pacl_update (Bjørnskov Rode 2020), well measures derived polity (Marshall, Gurr, Jaggers 2019), including peps (Moon et al. 2006), latent variable indexes like uds, heavily influenced inclusion polity scores (Pemstein, Meserve, Melton 2013), pitf scores (Taylor Ulfelder 2015), built polity.

title: Replicating and Extending the UD scores of Pemstein, Meserve, and Melton
text: first step prepare democracy measures use mirt. focus first replicating 2011 release UDS, explain extend augment scores. order replicate original UD scores, need use PMM’s replication dataset (Pemstein, Meserve, Melton 2013). dataset included package: just need generate data frame democracy scores datasets names ending _pmm. can use function prepare_democracy_data() put data right format use mirt. transformation prepare_democracy_data(), data looks like : Data summary Variable type: numeric transformation, looks like : Data summary Variable type: numeric function prepare_democracy_data() gets rid “empty rows” (country-years measurements democracy chosen indexes; patterns make mirt fail) transforms selected democracy indexes ordinal variables suitable use mirt, mostly following advice Pemstein, Meserve, Melton’s original article (2010). particular, prepare_democracy_data() try following dataset: selected index contains string arat, function assumes index Arat’s (Arat 1991) 0-109 democracy score, cuts 7 intervals following cutoffs: 50, 60, 70, 80, 90, 100. resulting score ordinal 1 8 (following Pemstein, Meserve, Melton’s advice). selected index contains string bollen, function assumes index Bollen’s (Bollen2001?) 0-100 democracy score, cuts 10 intervals following cutoffs: 10,20,30,40,50,60,70,80, 90. resulting score ordinal 1 10 (following Pemstein, Meserve, Melton’s advice). selected index contains string wgi, function assumes index World Governance Indicator’s “Voice Accountability” index (Kaufmann Kraay 2020), cut 20 categories. resulting score ordinal 1 20. selected index contains string eiu, function assumes index Economist Intelligence Unit’s democracy index (eiu2021?), cut 20 categories. resulting score ordinal 1 20. selected index contains string hadenius_pmm, function assumes index Hadenius’s 0-10 democracy score (hadenius1992?), cut 8 intervals following cutoffs: 1, 2,3,4, 7, 8, 9. resulting score ordinal 1 8 (following Pemstein, Meserve, Melton’s advice). selected index contains string munck, function assumes index Munck’s 0-1 democracy score (Munck 2009), cut 4 intervals following cutoffs: 0.5,0.5,0.75, 0.99. resulting score ordinal 1 4 (following Pemstein, Meserve, Melton’s advice). selected index contains string peps, function assumes index one variants Participation-Enhanced Polity Score (Moon et al. 2006), round value (eliminating decimal) transform ordinal measure 1 21. selected index contains string polity, function assumes Polity IV Polity 5 score (Marshall Gurr 2020; Marshall, Gurr, Jaggers 2019), thus set values -10 NA transform variable ordinal measure 1 21. selected index contains string polyarchy_inclusion_dimension polyarchy_contestation_dimension, function assumes one two dimensions polyarchy estimated Coppedge, Alvarez, Maldonado (2008), cut 20 categories. resulting score ordinal 1 20. selected index contains string v2x, function assumes one v2x_ continuous indexes democracy V-Dem dataset (vdem11dataset?), cut 20 categories. resulting score ordinal 1 20. selected index contains string csvdmi svdmi_2016, function assumes one continuous indexes democracy SVMDI dataset (Gründler Krieger 2016, 2018), cut 20 categories. resulting score ordinal 1 20. selected index contains string bti, function assumes Bertelsman Transformation Index (bti2020?), cut 20 categories. resulting score ordinal 1 20. selected index contains string vanhanen_democratization vanhanen_pmm, function assumes Vanhanen’s index democratization (vanhanen2014?), cut 8 intervals following cutoffs: 5,10,15,20,25,30, 35 (following Pemstein, Meserve, Melton’s advice). resulting score ordinal 1 8. prepare_democracy_data() also work column names contain following strings: anckar (assumes ’s democracy indicator AnckarFredriksson2018?) anrr (assumes ’s democracy indicator Acemoglu et al. 2019) blm (assumes ’s Bowman, Lehoucq, Mahoney 2005) bmr (assumes ’s bmr2007?) doorenspleet (assumes ’s Doorenspleet 2000) dsvmdi (assumes ’s discrete machine-learning index Gründler Krieger 2018) e_v2x (assumes ’s one “ordinal” indexes V-dem project, Coppedge et al. 2025) fh freedomhouse (assumes ’s fh2020?) gwf (assumes ’s Geddes, Wright, Frantz 2014 - dichotomous democracy indicator ) kailitz (assumes ’s Kailitz2013? - democracy/electoral autocracy/non-democracy indicator ) lied lexical_index (assumes ’s Skaaning, Gerring, Bartusevičius 2015) mainwaring (assumes ’s Mainwaring, Pérez-Liñán, Brinks 2014) magaloni (assumes ’s Magaloni, Chu, Min 2013) pacl cgv (assumes ’s Cheibub, Gandhi, Vreeland 2009 later updates) pitf (assumes ’s measure democracy used Goldstone et al. 2010; Taylor Ulfelder 2015) polyarchy (assumes ’s Coppedge Reinicke 1990) prc (assumes ’s prc_gasiorowski1996? later update) przeworski (assumes ’s “regime” variable Przeworski 2013) reign (assumes ’s democracy/dictatorship indicator Bell 2016) svolik (assumes ’s democracy/dictatorship indicator svolik2012?) ulfelder (assumes ’s Ulfelder 2012) utip (assumes ’s Hsu 2008) wahman_teorell_hadenius wth (assumes ’s democracy/non-democracy indicator Wahman, Teorell, Hadenius 2013). cases function prepare_democracy_data() transforms values scores running .numeric(unclass(factor(x))), transforms index ordinal variables 1 number categories. using democracy indexes included democracy dataset, want use custom measures democracy, transform particular way, simply need ensure “blank” country-years data (.e., country-years without democracy measurements; package provides convenience function remove_empty_rows() purpose) indexes using ordinal measures 1 N every category present data. mirt pretty flexible forgiving: accept ordinal variables range attempt transform indexes every category within distance 1 neighboring categories. ’s useful good sense algorithm data begin!

title: Replicating and Extending the UD scores of Pemstein, Meserve, and Melton
text: ’ve prepared data, can fit model follows: just tells mirt fit one-factor, full information graded response model like (pmm2010uds2010?), calculate standard errors coefficients. (See ?mirt details many options can use tweak model, see paper fuller description model useful ). Fitting model reasonably fast: can easily check model converges accounts variance democracy indexes: can extract latent democracy scores, either via mirt::fscore(), via package’s convenient wrapper democracy_scores (returns tidy dataset latent scores automatically calculates 95% confidence intervals): can check scores , fact, almost perfectly correlated Pemstein, Meserve, Melton’s 2011 UDS release: (details relationship original UD scores replicated scores produced using method, see working paper).

title: Replicating and Extending the UD scores of Pemstein, Meserve, and Melton

(2006), trichotomous democracy indicator calculated Magaloni, Min, Chu’s “Autocracies World” datset (Magaloni, Chu, Min 2013), dichotomous democracy indicator calculated Hsu (2008), REIGN dataset Bell (2016), extends Geddes, Wright, Frantz (2014), dichotomous democracy indicator Acemoglu et al. what: Extracting useful information from a model
title: Replicating and Extending the UD scores of Pemstein, Meserve, and Melton
text: mirt package offers great number powerful tools examine diagnose fitted model, including functions extract model cutpoints item information curves. package also contains two convenience functions wrap mirt tools quickly extract democracy rater discrimination parameters, rater cutoffs, rater information curves model produced procedure tidy data frame format suitable graphing. , example, can replicate figures PMM’s original paper:    Finally, package offers simple function estimate probability given country democratic another given year, accounting uncertainty UD-style measures. example, suppose want know probability USA democratic France year 2000 replicated 2011 scores extended model: perhaps wish know probability United States democratic year 2000 year 1953:
code: replication_2011_cutpoints <- cutpoints(replication_2011_model, type ="score") replication_2011_cutpoints # A tibble: 85 × 6    variable   estimate  pct025    pct975      se num_obs    <chr>         <dbl>   <dbl>     <dbl>   <dbl>   <int>  1 pmm_arat   -1.43    -1.42   -1.44     0.00526    3873  2 pmm_arat   -1.02    -1.02   -1.01     0.00150    3873  3 pmm_arat   -0.427   -0.449  -0.403    0.0124     3873  4 pmm_arat   -0.0422  -0.0795 -0.000821 0.0211     3873  5 pmm_arat    0.421    0.357   0.491    0.0361     3873  6 pmm_arat    1.42     1.28    1.58     0.0798     3873  7 pmm_blm    -0.00364 -0.0451  0.0889   0.0472      275  8 pmm_blm     0.473    0.219   1.04     0.290       275  9 pmm_bollen -1.53    -1.50   -1.55     0.0145      510 10 pmm_bollen -1.08    -1.07   -1.08     0.00243     510 # ℹ 75 more rows # We plot the "normalized" cutpoints ("estimate," in the same scale as the latent scores),  # not the untransformed ones ("par")  ggplot(data = replication_2011_cutpoints,         aes(x = variable, y = estimate,             ymin = pct025, ymax = pct975))  +    theme_bw() +    labs(x="",y="Unified democracy level rater cutoffs") +    geom_point() +    geom_errorbar() +    geom_hline(yintercept =0, color="red") +    coord_flip() # We can also plot discrimination parameters, which are in a different scale: replication_2011_discrimination <- cutpoints(replication_2011_model,                                               type ="discrimination")  replication_2011_discrimination # A tibble: 12 × 5    variable       estimate pct025 pct975 num_obs    <chr>             <dbl>  <dbl>  <dbl>   <int>  1 pmm_arat           3.54   3.35   3.72    3873  2 pmm_blm           13.6    8.45  18.8      275  3 pmm_bollen         5.21   4.48   5.95     510  4 pmm_fh             4.72   4.51   4.92    6438  5 pmm_hadenius      10.1    6.48  13.7      129  6 pmm_mainwaring    16.2   11.2   21.2      835  7 pmm_munck          5.48   4.33   6.63     342  8 pmm_pacl           6.50   6.05   6.95    9067  9 pmm_polity         5.44   5.21   5.67    8050 10 pmm_polyarchy      6.29   5.21   7.37     353 11 pmm_prc            6.64   6.22   7.06    6002 12 pmm_vanhanen       4.23   4.07   4.39    8965 ggplot(data = replication_2011_discrimination,         aes(x=reorder(variable,estimate),            y = estimate, ymin = pct025,             ymax = pct975))  +    theme_bw() +    labs(x="",y="Discrimination parameter for each rater        \n(higher value means fewer idiosyncratic\nerrors relative to latent score)") +    geom_point() +    geom_errorbar() +    coord_flip() # And we can plot item information curves for each rater: replication_2011_info <- raterinfo(replication_2011_model) replication_2011_info # A tibble: 732 × 3    rater    theta       info    <chr>    <dbl>      <dbl>  1 pmm_arat  -6   0.00000122  2 pmm_arat  -5.8 0.00000247  3 pmm_arat  -5.6 0.00000501  4 pmm_arat  -5.4 0.0000102  5 pmm_arat  -5.2 0.0000206  6 pmm_arat  -5   0.0000418  7 pmm_arat  -4.8 0.0000847  8 pmm_arat  -4.6 0.000172  9 pmm_arat  -4.4 0.000349 10 pmm_arat  -4.2 0.000707 # ℹ 722 more rows ggplot(data = replication_2011_info, aes(x=theta,y=info)) +    geom_path() +    facet_wrap(~rater) +    theme_bw() +    labs(x="Latent democracy score",y = "Information") +    theme(legend.position="bottom") prob_more(replication_2011_scores, "United States of America","France", 2000) [1] 0.8781908 prob_more(extended_scores, "United States of America","France", 2000) [1] 0.7718505 prob_more(replication_2011_scores,            "United States of America",           "United States of America",            c(2000,1953)) [1] 0.9179079 prob_more(extended_scores,            "United States of America",           "United States of America",            c(2000,1953)) [1] 0.9999987

Based on this classification scheme, we create a global dataset covering the time period 1800–2016. In the dataset, we make yearly observations for all countries that have been independent at any point in time since the Second World War. Regarding democracies, we first distinguish between republics and monarchies. We then split the category of republics into presidential, semi-presidential, and parliamentary systems. Within the category of monarchies, almost all systems are parliamentary, but a few countries are conferred to the category semi-monarchies. Authors differ markedly in terms of how autocratic regimes should be classified. In the present dataset, we classify autocratic countries into the following main categories: absolute monarchy, military rule, party-based rule, personalist rule, and oligarchy. Within the categories party-based rule and oligarchy, we also identify a number of subcategories.},   file = {C\:\\Users\\marquexa\\Zotero\\storage\\GZ9KBPSX\\41304_2018_149_MOESM1_ESM.docx;C\:\\Users\\marquexa\\Zotero\\storage\\LXD5DEMJ\\Anckar-2018-Classifying political regimes 1800.pdf;C\:\\Users\\marquexa\\Zotero\\storage\\QQSXXQ6Y\\41304_2018_149_MOESM2_ESM.xlsx}, } @Book{Arat1991,   title = {Democracy and Human Rights in Developing Countries},   author = {Zehra F. 2020 - Regime types and regime change A new dataset on d.pdf}, } @Article{bmr2012,   title = {A {{Complete Data Set}} of {{Political Regimes}}, 1800–2007},   author = {Carles Boix and Michael Miller and Sebastian Rosato},   year = {2012},   journal = {Comparative Political Studies},   volume = {46},   number = {12},   pages = {1523--1554},   doi = {10.1177/0010414012463905},   abstract = {This article updates and describes a widely used data set on democracy. Covering 1800–2007 and 213 countries, it represents the most comprehensive dichotomous measure of democracy currently available. We argue that our measure’s distinguishing features—a concrete, dichotomous coding and a long time span—are of critical value to empirical work on democracy. Inspired by Robert Dahl, we define a country as democratic if it satisfies conditions for both contestation and participation. Specifically, democracies feature political leaders chosen through free and fair elections and satisfy a threshold value of suffrage. After comparing our coding to that of other popular measures, we illustrate how democracy’s predictive factors have evolved since 1800. In particular, we show that economic modernization variables have steadily declined in their correlation with democracy over time.},   keywords = {data,democracy},   file = {C\:\\Users\\marquexa\\Zotero\\storage\\AMD8IB6A\\Comparative Political Studies-2013-Boix-1523-54 (1).pdf;C\:\\Users\\marquexa\\Zotero\\storage\\HYBQXFEW\\Boix et al. - 2012 - A complete dataset of political regimes, 1800-2007.pdf;C\:\\Users\\marquexa\\Zotero\\storage\\WKXZVINN\\Boix-2012-A Complete Data Set.pdf}, } @Misc{bollen2001,   title = {Cross-National Indicators of Liberal Democracy, 1950-1990},   author = {Kenneth A. (Stud. Comp. Int. Dev. 31(2):3–36, 1996). This extension focuses on how incumbents are removed from office. We argue that differences across regime measures must be taken seriously and that they should be evaluated in terms of whether they (1) serve to address important research questions, (2) can be interpreted meaningfully, and (3) are reproducible. what: Access and Manipulate Most Available Democracy Datasets
title: Access and Manipulate Most Available Democracy Datasets
text: package archives large number datasets measuring democracy use scholarly literature, provides functions access many others. can use access widely used datasets, including Polity5, Freedom House, Geddes, Wright, Frantz’ autocratic regimes dataset, Lexical Index Electoral Democracy, DD/ACLP/PACL/CGV dataset, main indexes V-Dem dataset, many others.

title: Access and Manipulate Most Available Democracy Datasets
text: package available Github. Install follows:

title: Access and Manipulate Most Available Democracy Datasets
text: vast majority use cases, can just type name dataset require. example, ’s DD/ACLP/PACL/CGV dataset: ’s Polity IV: ’s basic version V-Dem dataset, including 7 main indexes democracy: datasets package fully documented; type ?pacl example see documentation PACL dataset.

title: Access and Manipulate Most Available Democracy Datasets
text: Though datasets can accessed directly package, datasets can also downloaded directly internet, including family datasets released Freedom House full V-Dem dataset. download Freedom House dataset, use download_* family functions; download full V-Dem dataset, use vdemdata package. package include main indexes version 15.0 V-Dem (see vdem_simple), don’t need use vdemdata package interested higher-level indexes democracy. can also download directly latest versions World Bank’s Voice Accountability Index World Governance Indicators Polity5, though also archived versions two package. example, can download process Freedom House “Freedom World” dataset follows: downloads latest update “Freedom World” dataset (1972-2021, corresponding 2022 report), puts country-year format (extracting relevant info awful Excel table Freedom House makes available), calculates variables fh_total fh_total_reversed, adds state system information, including standardized country name, Gleditsch-Ward country code Correlates War country code. can also, however, use archived version (fh): democracy datasets can often also “re-downloaded” websites creators maintainers required. example, one can either access PACL directly typing re-download dataset Jose Antonio Cheibub’s website follows: two data frames identical: thus normally use “archived” versions datasets, unless want manipulate raw data (using redownload_* functions option return_raw = TRUE), think might updated since installed package.

title: Access and Manipulate Most Available Democracy Datasets
text: package also offers series convenience functions calculate latent variable indexes democracy (following Pemstein, Meserve, Melton’s 2010 article “Democratic Compromise: Latent Variable Analysis Ten Measures Regime Type”); see vignette Replicating Extending UD scores Pemstein, Meserve, Melton. also contains pre-calculated extended version scores, available extended_uds:
code: extended_uds #> # A tibble: 37,738 × 20 #>    extended_country_name   GWn  cown in_GW_system  year      z1 se_z1 z1_pct975 #>    <chr>                 <dbl> <dbl> <lgl>        <dbl>   <dbl> <dbl>     <dbl> #>  1 Abkhazia                396    NA FALSE         1997 -0.0558 0.320     0.571 #>  2 Abkhazia                396    NA FALSE         1998 -0.0558 0.320     0.571 #>  3 Abkhazia                396    NA FALSE         1999 -0.0558 0.320     0.571 #>  4 Abkhazia                396    NA FALSE         2000 -0.0558 0.320     0.571 #>  5 Abkhazia                396    NA FALSE         2001 -0.0558 0.320     0.571 #>  6 Abkhazia                396    NA FALSE         2002 -0.0558 0.320     0.571 #>  7 Abkhazia                396    NA FALSE         2003 -0.0558 0.320     0.571 #>  8 Abkhazia                396    NA FALSE         2004 -0.0558 0.320     0.571 #>  9 Abkhazia                396    NA FALSE         2005  0.144  0.318     0.767 #> 10 Abkhazia                396    NA FALSE         2006  0.144  0.318     0.767 #> # ℹ 37,728 more rows #> # ℹ 12 more variables: z1_pct025 <dbl>, z1_adj <dbl>, z1_pct975_adj <dbl>, #> #   z1_pct025_adj <dbl>, z1_as_prob <dbl>, z1_pct975_as_prob <dbl>, #> #   z1_pct025_as_prob <dbl>, z1_adj_as_prob <dbl>, z1_pct975_adj_as_prob <dbl>, #> #   z1_pct025_adj_as_prob <dbl>, num_measures <int>, measures <list>

title: Access and Manipulate Most Available Democracy Datasets
text: package also includes couple convenience functions work historical democracy data determine state system membership. first country_year_coder, works like countrycode package, except able determine state system information country-year pairs. Suppose dataset: want add state system information. country_year_coder ! country_year_coder tries match just country name country code (countrycode ), also figure appropriate state system code given year. (, example, function figures Germany 1970 get COW code 260, Germany 1992 get 255 - though retain 260 code Gleditsch Ward system states. , incidentally, download_fh adds correct COW GW country codes Freedom House’s Excel data). also tries figure whether given country-year specific state system list. (example , Germany 1945 listed member state system either COW Gleditsch Ward, since occupied Allies 31 December 1945, listed member state system Polity IV Federal Republic, though polity score -66, “interregnum”). One nice thing country_year_coder (humble opinion!) can sometimes correct country coding errors; ’ve run across one dataset supposed COW code 255 Federal Republic Germany period 1955-1990, prevent clean join dataset correct COW code, caught country_year_coder. also function allows create blank state system panel three main state systems:

title: Access and Manipulate Most Available Democracy Datasets
text: Feedback welcome! Note functions package can quite slow: generating full democracy dataset (including downloading Freedom House, Polity, WGI) applying country_year_coder large data frame can take time. Suggestions accelerate code welcome. country_year_coder fails give correct answers weird edge cases mostly involving Yugoslavia, Germany, Vietnam. run across cases, let know.

title: The Anckar-Fredriksson dataset of political regimes — anckar
text: anckar_country country name, original dataset, minimal modification. Use extended_country_name instead want consistent name. anckar_ccode codebook says COW code; looks like modified version Polity code (USSR = 364, example). Use cown GWn instead. abbreviation World Bank country abbreviation. year calendar year. democracy identical version 2 Boix, Miller Rosato's Dichotomous democracy measure (democracy_omitteddata; see bmr). Supplemented countries period 2011-2016, well Liechtenstein 1866-1990, Monaco 1862-2016, San Marino 1800-1992, Anckar Fredriksson. 1 = democracy, 0 = non-democracy. monarchy Distinguishes monarchies republics democratic countries. NA non-democracies. Vales: 0 Republic, 1 Monarchy, 7 Hybrid. regimebroadcat Regime type. Classification broad categories: Parliamentarism, Semi-presidentialism, Presidentialism, Semi-monarchy, Party-based rule, Personalist rule, Military rule, Absolute monarchy, Oligarchy regimenarrowcat Regime type. Classification narrow categories: Parliamentarism, Semi-presidentialism, Presidentialism, Semi-monarchy, Single-party rule, Multi-party authoritarian rule, Personalist rule, Military rule, Absolute monarchy, Monarchic oligarchy, oligarchy. popelection Indicates head state popularly elected democratic republics. Values 0 Head state popularly elected; 1 Head state popularly elected. cases variable NA non-democracies; unclear .

what: Standard descriptive variables (generated by this package)
title: The Arat measure of democracy — arat_pmm
text: extended_country_name name country Gleditsch-Ward system states, official name entity (non-sovereign entities states Gleditsch Ward system states) else common name disputed cases official name (e.g., Western Sahara, Hyderabad). Gleditsch Ward scheme sometimes indicates common name country (parentheses) name earlier incarnation state: thus, Germany (Prussia), Russia (Soviet Union), Madagascar (Malagasy), etc. details, see Gleditsch, Kristian S. & Michael D. Ward. 1999. "Interstate System Membership: Revised List Independent States since 1816." International Interactions 25: 393-413. list can found http://privatewww.essex.ac.uk/~ksg/statelist.html. GWn Gleditsch Ward's numeric country code, Gleditsch Ward list independent states. cown Correlates War numeric country code, 2016 version. differs Gleditsch Ward's numeric country code cases. See http://www.correlatesofwar.org/data-sets/state-system-membership full list. in_GW_system Whether state "system" (, independent sovereign), according Gleditsch Ward, particular date. Matches end year; , example South Vietnam 1975 FALSE , according Gleditsch Ward, country ended April 1975 (absorbed North Vietnam). also TRUE dates beyond 2012 countries end , depsite fact Gleditsch Ward list updated since.

title: The Bernhard, Nordstrom & Reenock Event History Coding of Democratic Breakdowns — bnr
text: Taken BNR dataset description website: (Time Series:  1913-2005, n: 3654, N: 126, Mean number countries per year: 39.28 , Mean number years per country: 29.46). event variable binary coding democracies 1913 2005 prepared use event history analysis.  Countries meet minimum conditions democracy (see ) enter dataset coded "0."  countries cease meet minimum criteria coded "1" exit dataset.  time frame onset 1913 function first country (Norway) meets minimum conditions. series terminate either breakdown various years right censorship 2005. minimal conditions based Dahl's notion polyarchy (competitiveness, inclusiveness) combined Linz Stepan's stateness criteria. Competitiveness: include countries competitive elections without gross distortions fairness.  excluded cases set democracies detected outcome changing vote fraud, either extensive extreme violence inhibited voters expressing , political parties representing substantial portion population banned. Inclusiveness:  include competitive polities least fifty percent adult citizens enfranchised vote set democracies. Stateness:  also paid careful attention questions sovereignty, including set democracies many cases, despite competitive elections, full sovereignty formally achieved.  also excluded internal wars twenty percent population territory control state progress. bnr_country original country name dataset. bnr_cowcode original COW country code dataset. year Calendar year event event coding. 0 = democracy, 1 = termination. bnr bnr_extended dataset. 0 = non-democracy, 1 = democracy. Years termination event coded 0. Note reverse event variable, 0 indicates democracy; bnr dataset originally created survival analysis.

title: The Bertelsmann Transformation Index — bti
text: Bertelsmann Stiftung. Transformation Index Bertelsmann Stiftung 2024. Tech. rep. Bertelsmann Stiftung, 2024. Available https://bti-project.org/en/index/political-transformation.

title: The Bertelsmann Transformation Index — bti
text: BTI calculated Biennial Intervals approximately 137 countries since 2006. bti_country original country name dataset. year Calendar year. two years earlier report date. example, codebook indicates BTI report 2020 assesses situation January 2019, assigned calendar year 2018. bti_region Region. Ranking_Status_Index Country rank status index, "ranks countries according state democracy market economy". S_Status_Index Status index, combines democracy economy index. SI_Democracy_Status Democracy status index. Q1_Stateness (Q1.1-1.4) Scores questions stateness (1-10), monopoly use force basic administration. BTI codebook says concept measures whether "clarity nation's existence state adequately established differentiated power structures." See codebook <https://www.bti-project.org/content/en/downloads/codebooks/BTI_2020_Codebook.pdf> details. Q2_Political_Participation (Q2.1-2.4) Scores questions political participation (1-10), free fair elections freedom expression. BTI codebook says concept indicates whether "populace decides rules, political freedoms". See codebook https://www.bti-project.org/content/en/downloads/codebooks/BTI_2020_Codebook.pdf details. Q3_Rule_of_Law (Q3.1-3.4) Scores questions rule law (1-10), checks balances civil rights. BTI codebook says concept measures whether "state powers check balance one another ensure civil rights." See codebook https://www.bti-project.org/content/en/downloads/codebooks/BTI_2020_Codebook.pdf details. Q4_Stability_of_Democratic_Institutions (Q4.1-4.2) Scores questions stability democratic institutions (1-10), performance democratic institutions commitment democratic institutions. BTI codebook says concept measures whether "democratic institutions capable performing, adequately accepted." See codebook https://www.bti-project.org/content/en/downloads/codebooks/BTI_2020_Codebook.pdf details. Q5_Political_and_Social_Integration (Q5.1-5.4) Scores questions political social integration (1-10), rootedness party system social capital. BTI codebook says concept measures whether "Stable patterns representation exist mediating society state; also consolidated civic culture." See codebook https://www.bti-project.org/content/en/downloads/codebooks/BTI_2020_Codebook.pdf details. SII_Economy_Status Economy status index. Q6_Level_of_Socioeconomic_Development (Q6.1) Score question level socioeconomic development (1-10). BTI codebook says concept measures whether "principle, country's level development permits adequate freedom choice citizens." See codebook https://www.bti-project.org/content/en/downloads/codebooks/BTI_2020_Codebook.pdf details. Q7_Organization_of_the_Market_and_Competition (Q7.1-7.4) Scores questions market organization competition (1-10), market organization banking system. BTI codebook says concept measures whether "clear rules stable, market-based competition." See codebook https://www.bti-project.org/content/en/downloads/codebooks/BTI_2020_Codebook.pdf details. Q8_Monetary_and_Fiscal_Stability (Q8.1-8.2) Scores questions monetary fiscal stability (1-10). BTI codebook says concept measures whether "institutional political precautions achieve monetary fiscal stability." See codebook https://www.bti-project.org/content/en/downloads/codebooks/BTI_2020_Codebook.pdf details. Q9_Private_Property (Q9.1-9.2) Scores questions private property property rights (1-10). BTI codebook says concept measures whether "adequate conditions support functional private sector." See codebook https://www.bti-project.org/content/en/downloads/codebooks/BTI_2020_Codebook.pdf details. Q10_Welfare_Regime (Q10.1-10.2) Scores questions welfare policy safety nets (1-10). BTI codebook says concept measures whether "viable arrangements compensate social risks." See codebook https://www.bti-project.org/content/en/downloads/codebooks/BTI_2020_Codebook.pdf details. Q11_Economic_Performance (Q11.1) Score question economic performance (1-10). BTI codebook says concept measures whether "economy's performance points solid development." See codebook https://www.bti-project.org/content/en/downloads/codebooks/BTI_2020_Codebook.pdf details. Q12_Sustainability (Q12.1-12.2) Scores questions sustainability, environmental policy R&D policy (1-10). BTI codebook says concept measures whether "Economic growth balanced, environmentally sustainable future-oriented." See codebook https://www.bti-project.org/content/en/downloads/codebooks/BTI_2020_Codebook.pdf details. Ranking_Governance_Index Ranking governance status index. G_Governance_Index Governance status index. Q13_Level_of_Difficulty (Q13.1-13.5) Scores questions level difficulty governance (1-10), plus rescaled measures objective difficulty (education, stateness, GNI per capita). See codebook https://www.bti-project.org/content/en/downloads/codebooks/BTI_2020_Codebook.pdf details. Q14_Steering_Capability (Q14.1-14.3) Scores questions government's steering capability, prioritization policy learning (1-10). BTI codebook says concept measures whether "government manages reforms effectively can achieve policy priorities." See codebook https://www.bti-project.org/content/en/downloads/codebooks/BTI_2020_Codebook.pdf details. Q15_Resource_Efficiency (Q15.1-15.3) Scores questions government's efficiency, efficient use assets anti-corruption capability (1-10). BTI codebook says concept measures whether "government makes optimum use available resources." See codebook https://www.bti-project.org/content/en/downloads/codebooks/BTI_2020_Codebook.pdf details. Q16_Consensus-Building (Q16.1-16.6) Scores questions government's ability build consensus, consensus goals civil society participation reconciliation (1-10). BTI codebook says concept measures whether "political leadership establishes broad consensus reform actors society without sacrificing reform goals." See codebook https://www.bti-project.org/content/en/downloads/codebooks/BTI_2020_Codebook.pdf details. Q17_Consensus-Building (Q17.1-17.3) Scores questions government's international cooperation, effective use support credibility regional cooperation (1-10). BTI codebook says concept measures whether "political leadership willing able cooperate external supporters organizations." See codebook https://www.bti-project.org/content/en/downloads/codebooks/BTI_2020_Codebook.pdf details. pol_sys dichotomous indicator political system. 1 = democracy, 0 = autocracy. cat_dem_stat fine-grained indicator democracy, ranging 1 (democratic) 5 (least democratic). cat_dem_stat_label label fine-grained indicator democracy, ranging "Democracies consolidation" "Hard-line autocracies". report_year Report year. always two years year

code: country_year_coder(   tbl,   country_col,   date_col,   code_col,   code_type = "cown",   to_system = c("GW", "polity", "cow"),   match_type = c("country and code", "code only"),   include_in_output = c("extended_country_name", "GWn", "cown", "in_GW_system"),   verbose = TRUE,   debug = FALSE,   match_final_year = FALSE )

title: Country-Year State System Coding — country_year_coder
text: tbl data frame (least) country year columns. country_col (unquoted) name country column. Defaults country. missing, code_col given, function defaults matching code match country names. saves time, always possible can introduce errors code column incorrect. date_col (unquoted) name year column. Defaults year. Must exist tbl - otherwise just use countrycode::countrycode care country-year matching. code_col (unquoted) name code column. Defaults NULL. code_type Type code match (needed code_col NULL). Defaults "cown". Can unambiguous substring following: "GWn": Numeric code country Gleditsch-Ward system states (http://privatewww.essex.ac.uk/~ksg/statelist.html). similar, identical, Correlates War Polity codes. See vignette package differences. "GWc": Three letter code country Gleditsch-Ward system states (http://privatewww.essex.ac.uk/~ksg/statelist.html). similar, identical, Correlates War Polity codes. See vignette package overview differences systems. "extended_GWn": Identical GWn, includes number commonly used codes units doubtful sovereignty (751 Hyderabad incorporation India, 666.001 666.002 Israel pre 1967 borders occupied territories, 605 Western Sahara). codes used UCDP/PRIO (https://www.prio.org/Data/Armed-Conflict/UCDP-PRIO/) datasets. "extended_GWc": Identical GWc, includes number commonly used codes units doubtful sovereignty (HYD Hyderabad incorporation India, ISR.1 ISR.2 Israel pre 1967 borders amd occupied territories, SAH Western Sahara). codes used UCDP/PRIO (https://www.prio.org/Data/Armed-Conflict/UCDP-PRIO/) datasets. "cown": Numeric code country Correlates War system states (http://www.correlatesofwar.org/data-sets/cow-country-codes). similar, identical, Gleditsch Ward Polity codes. See vignette package overview differences systems. "cowc": Three letter code country Correlates War system states (http://www.correlatesofwar.org/data-sets/cow-country-codes). similar, identical, Gleditsch Ward Polity codes. See vignette package overview differences systems. "polity_ccode": Numeric code country Polity IV dataset (http://www.systemicpeace.org/polity/polity4.htm). similar, identical, Gleditsch Ward COW codes. See vignette package differences. "polity_scode": Three letter code country Polity IV dataset (http://www.systemicpeace.org/polity/polity4.htm). similar, identical, Gleditsch Ward COW codes. See vignette package overview differences systems. "eurostat": Eurostat 2-letter country code. Taken countrycode. "eu28": Whether state member European Union (December 2015), without special territories. Taken countrycode. "fao": Food Agriculture Organization United Nations numerical country code. Taken countrycode. "fips105": FIPS 10-5 (Federal Information Processing Standard) 2-letter country code. Taken countrycode. "icao": International Civil Aviation Organization 2-letter country code. Taken countrycode. "icao_region": International Civil Aviation Organization region code. Taken countrycode. "imf": International Monetary Fund numeric country code. Taken countrycode. "ioc": International Olympic Committee 3-letter country code. Taken countrycode. "iso2c": ISO-2 character. Taken countrycode. "iso3c": ISO-3 character. Taken countrycode. "iso2n": ISO-2 numeric. Taken countrycode. "iso3n": ISO-3 numeric. Taken countrycode. "un": United Nations numerical code. Taken countrycode. "wb": World Bank (similar identical iso3c). Taken countrycode. "wb_api2c": World Bank API 2 character code. Taken countrycode. "wb_api3c": World Bank API 3 character code. Taken countrycode. "wvs": World Values Survey numeric code. Taken countrycode. to_system State system match . Default Gledistsch Ward. match_type match countries provided code column; possible options "country code" (looks country column well code column, latter supplied) "code " (matches code column). latter option used confident code column accurate missing codes, country name column present. Default "country code". Can abbreviated (e.g., "country" "country code") include_in_output Columns include output. Defaults c("extended_country_name", "GWn", "cown", "in_GW_system"), can character vector containing combination column names internal database country codes. possibilities : "GW_country_name": name country Gleditsch-Ward system states (http://privatewww.essex.ac.uk/~ksg/statelist.html) (Gleditsch War 1999). "extended_country_name": name country Gleditsch-Ward system states (http://privatewww.essex.ac.uk/~ksg/statelist.html) (Gleditsch War 1999), official name entity (non-sovereign entities states Gleditsch Ward system states) else common name disputed cases official name (e.g., Western Sahara, Hyderabad). "cow_country_name": name state Correlates War state system (2016 version). See http://www.correlatesofwar.org/data-sets/cow-country-codes details. NA country COW system states. "polity_country_name": name state official Polity dataset. NA country Polity. "country_name_en": official name country (official short English country name), defined ISO organization. Taken countrycode::countrycode. See also https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1. names missing state longer exists controversy sovereign status. "GWn": Numeric code country Gleditsch-Ward system states (http://privatewww.essex.ac.uk/~ksg/statelist.html) (Gleditsch War 1999). similar, identical, Correlates War Polity codes. See vignette package differences. "extended_GWn": Identical GWn, includes number commonly used codes units doubtful sovereignty (751 Hyderabad incorporation India, 666.001 666.002 Israel pre 1967 borders amd occupied territories, 605 Western Sahara). codes used UCDP/PRIO (https://www.prio.org/Data/Armed-Conflict/UCDP-PRIO/) datasets. "GWc": Three letter code country Gleditsch-Ward system states (http://privatewww.essex.ac.uk/~ksg/statelist.html) (Gleditsch War 1999). similar, identical, Correlates War Polity codes. See vignette package overview differences systems. "extended_GWc": Identical GWc, includes number commonly used codes units doubtful sovereignty (HYD Hyderabad incorporation India, 666.001 666.002 Israel pre 1967 borders amd occupied territories, 605 Western Sahara). codes used UCDP/PRIO (https://www.prio.org/Data/Armed-Conflict/UCDP-PRIO/) datasets. "cown": Numeric code country Correlates War system states (http://www.correlatesofwar.org/data-sets/cow-country-codes), 2016 release. similar, identical, Gleditsch Ward Polity codes. See vignette package overview differences systems. "cowc": Three letter code country Correlates War system states (http://www.correlatesofwar.org/data-sets/cow-country-codes), 2016 release. similar, identical, Gleditsch Ward Polity codes. See vignette package overview differences systems. "polity_ccode": Numeric code country Polity IV dataset (http://www.systemicpeace.org/polity/polity4.htm). similar, identical, Gleditsch Ward COW codes. See vignette package differences. "polity_scode": Three letter code country Polity IV dataset (http://www.systemicpeace.org/polity/polity4.htm). similar, identical, Gleditsch Ward COW codes. See vignette package overview differences systems. "regex": regular expression used match country name. Useful debugging. "GW_startdate": entry date state international system (usually date independence, though can one country entered exited state system different times), according Gleditsch Ward, 1 January 1816, whichever later. NA country never Gleditsch Ward system states. "GW_enddate": exit date state international system (usually date state lost independence, though can one), according Gleditsch Ward, NA country still international system time dataset compiled. NA country never Gleditsch Ward system states. "cow_startdate": entry date state international system (usually date independence, though can one country entered exited state system different times), according Correlates War, 1 January 1800, whichever later. always NA country never Correlates War system states. "cow_enddate": exit date state international system (usually date state lost independence, though can one), according Correlates War system, NA country still international system time dataset compiled. always NA country never Correlates War system states. "official_region": Regions defined World Bank Development Indicators. Taken countrycode. "extended_region": "official_region", except adds region information historical states. assigns "Austria-Hungary" (invented) region "Central Europe", since Hungary assigned Eastern Europe Austria Western Europe World Bank scheme. "official_continent": Continents defined World Bank Development Indicators. Taken countrycode. "extended_continent": "official_continent", except adds continent information historical states. NA Antarctica number isolated islands. "lon": rough longitude state, obtained geocoding official country name via ggmap::geocode (manual adjustments historical states). "lat": rough latitude state, obtained geocoding official country name via ggmap::geocode (manual adjustments historical states). "microstate": Whether state microstate, according Gleditsch. tentative list microstates available http://privatewww.essex.ac.uk/~ksg/statelist.html. "in_GW_system": Whether state "system" (, independent sovereign), according Gleditsch Ward, particular date. "in_cow_system": Whether state "system" (, independent sovereign), according Correlates War system, particular date. "in_polity_system": Whether state "system" (, independent sovereign), according Polity IV system, particular date. ar5: IPCC's regional mapping used Fifth Assessment Report (AR5) Reference Concentration Pathways (RCP). Taken countrycode. continent: Continent defined World Bank Development Indicators. Taken countrycode. "eurocontrol_pru": European Organisation Safety Air Navigation region. Taken countrycode. "eurocontrol_statfor": European Organisation Safety Air Navigation region. Taken countrycode. "eurostat": Eurostat 2-letter country code. Taken countrycode. "eu28": Whether state member European Union (December 2015), without special territories. Taken countrycode. "fao": Food Agriculture Organization United Nations numerical country code. Taken countrycode. "fips105": FIPS 10-5 (Federal Information Processing Standard) 2-letter country code. Taken countrycode. "icao": International Civil Aviation Organization 2-letter country code. Taken countrycode. "icao_region": International Civil Aviation Organization region code. Taken countrycode. "imf": International Monetary Fund numeric country code. Taken countrycode. "ioc": International Olympic Committee 3-letter country code. Taken countrycode. "iso2c": ISO-2 character. Taken countrycode. "iso3c": ISO-3 character. Taken countrycode. "iso2n": ISO-2 numeric. Taken countrycode. "iso3n": ISO-3 numeric. Taken countrycode. "un": United Nations numerical code. Taken countrycode. "wb": World Bank (similar identical iso3c). Taken countrycode. "wb_api2c": World Bank API 2 character code. Taken countrycode. "wb_api3c": World Bank API 3 character code. Taken countrycode. "wvs": World Values Survey numeric code. Taken countrycode. "country_name_ar": country name (Arabic). Taken countrycode. "country_name_de": country name (German). Taken countrycode. "country_name_es": country name (Spanish). Taken countrycode. "country_name_fr": country name (French). Taken countrycode. "country_name_ru": country name (Russian). Taken countrycode. "country_name_zh": country name (Chinese). Taken countrycode. verbose Prints information countries matched multiple times, name changes, problems encountered processing data. Default TRUE. debug Returns additional columns useful debugging. Default FALSE. match_final_year Whether classify final year country "system". example, TRUE, country-year pair "Republic Vietnam 1975"  appear "system" 1975, though country ended 1975; FALSE appear system, Republic Vietnam (South Vietnam) ceased exist end 1975. Use care; may result multiple matches. Default FALSE.

Surveys 1981 1988 covered periods Jan. 1981-Aug. 1982, Aug. 1982-Nov. 1983, Nov. 1983-Nov. 1984, Nov. 1984-Nov. 1985, Nov. 1985-Nov. 1986, Nov. 1986-Nov. 1987, Nov. 1987-Nov. 1988, Nov.1988-Dec.1989, results assigned years 1982, 1983, 1984, 1985, 1986, 1987, 1988, 1989. pr: Political rights, 1 7, 7 means violations political rights. Note South Africa 1973 assigned two values (one white one black South Africa). given "free" values. See notes details. cl: Civil liberties, 1 7, 7 means violations civil rights. Note South Africa 1973 assigned two values (one white one black South Africa). given "free" values. See notes details status: Political status. Free, free, partly free. See notes details. fh_total: Sum pr cl. Higher values "less free." fh_total_reversed: Reversed fh_total, higher values "free."

title: Freedom House
text: FH's Freedom World methodology discussion: Methodological changes effected periodically. discussions changes, please consult methodology essays various editions survey. full explanation current methodology, please consult recent edition survey. "PR" stands "Political Rights," "CL" stands "Civil Liberties," "Status" Freedom Status. Political Rights Civil Liberties measured one--seven scale, one representing highest degree Freedom seven lowest. 2003, countries whose combined average ratings Political Rights Civil Liberties fell 1.0 2.5 designated "Free"; 3.0 5.5 "Partly Free," 5.5 7.0 "Free." Beginning ratings 2003, countries whose combined average ratings fall 3.0 5.0 "Partly Free," 5.5 7.0 "Free." Ratings territories included table. Several countries became independent, split two countries, merged neighboring state. Scores countries given period existence independent states. survey years refer various editions Freedom World, except Jan.-Feb. 1973 Jan.-Feb. 1977, bimonthly journal Freedom Issue. first Freedom World book-length survey 1978 edition. 1972, South Africa rated "White" (2,3 Free) "Black" (5,6 Free). Yugoslavia, ratings 1999 2002 country remained following departures 1991 1992 Slovenia, Croatia, Macedonia Bosnia-Herzegovina. February 2003, Yugoslav parliament adopted constitutional charter establishing state Serbia Montenegro. Thus, beginning 2003, Yugoslavia listed "Serbia Montenegro."	State Union Serbia Montenegro dissolved Montenegro withdrew June 2006, making Serbia independent state. Thus, ratings Serbia Montenegro listed separately beginning 2006.	 Kosovo first listed territory beginning 1992. Since 2009, listed independent country. South Sudan first listed independent country 2011 officially separating Sudan July 2011.	former Zaire listed Congo (Kinshasa), former Western Samoa listed Samoa.

Freedom House appear issue list electoral democracies 2021 Freedom World report, year 2020 available; list electoral democracies 2022 report, year 2021 available. 2020 thus "skipped". (principle possible reconstruct list electoral democracies using full FH data, methodology little opaque). electoral: Electoral democracy indicator. TRUE = yes, FALSE = . electoral_calc: Electoral democracy indicator, calculated full scores (see download_fh_full) using definition electoral democracy Freedom House uses 2017 onwards. TRUE = yes, FALSE = . Freedom House changed criteria designating electoral democracy 2018 edition Freedom World report, variable included allow users understand countries considered electoral democracies 2017 considered electoral democracies 2017. Freedom House methodology page notes, "beginning 2018 edition, countries require overall Civil Liberties score 30 better—addition score 7 better subcategory (Electoral Process), overall Political Rights score 20 better—qualify electoral democracy." change resulted 32 country-years classified electoral democracies 2017 considered electoral democracies using post-2017 criteria:   Note electoral_calc available years 2012, Freedom House make available full scores years 2012, despite fact list electoral democracies goes back 1989.

A2: score electoral process subcategory question 2. A3: score electoral process subcategory question 3. : aggregate score electoral process subcategory. B1: score political pluralism participation subcategory question  B2: score political pluralism participation subcategory question  B3: score political pluralism participation subcategory question  B4: score political pluralism participation subcategory question  B: aggregate score political pluralism participation subcategory. title: Freedom House All Data 2013-2024 — download_fh_full
text: FH's Freedom World methodology discussion: Methodological changes effected periodically. discussions changes, please consult methodology essays various editions survey. full explanation current methodology, please consult recent edition survey. "PR" stands "Political Rights," "CL" stands "Civil Liberties," "Status" Freedom Status. Political Rights Civil Liberties measured one--seven scale, one representing highest degree Freedom seven lowest. 2003, countries whose combined average ratings Political Rights Civil Liberties fell 1.0 2.5 designated "Free"; 3.0 5.5 "Partly Free," 5.5 7.0 "Free." Beginning ratings 2003, countries whose combined average ratings fall 3.0 5.0 "Partly Free," 5.5 7.0 "Free." Several countries became independent, split two countries, merged neighboring state. Scores countries given period existence independent states.

"0" code indicates reasonable confidence codings listed assigned historical cases. "1" code indicates codings covering period five years since recent polity change considered tentative new authority patterns emerge coalesce; cases subject review possible revision "smoothing" ... "2" code indicates information limited , , reservations concerning code assigned, often polity change occurred recently insufficient time elapsed render confident judgement nature authority changes; codes assigned considered "best assessment" require review possible revision (p. 12). fragment Polity5 manual, 2020 edition, pp. 12-13: Polity Fragmentation: variable codes operational existence separate polity, polities, comprising substantial territory population within recognized borders state coded polity exercises effective authority (effective authority may participatory coercive). Local autonomy arrangements voluntarily established accepted central local authorities considered fragmentation. polity can exercise relatively effective authority least 50 percent established territory necessarily considered condition "state failure" (.e., interruption interregnum, see , may may coincide active civil war). Polity fragmentation may result open warfare (active latent) foreign occupation may continue absence open warfare situation de facto separation remains unresolved unchallenged state. Examples de facto separation northern Cyprus since 1975 (Turkish occupation), NagornoKarabakh Azerbaijan since 1994 (Armenian occupation), Republika Srpska Bosnia since 1995 (NATO occupation), Abkhazia South Ossetia Georgia 1994, Chechnya Russia 1996 1999, Kosovo Serbia 1999 2008 (Kosovo became contested, independent state 2008). variable coded beginning year 2000; blank prior years (.e., yet coded historically). (0) overt fragmentation (1) Slight fragmentation: Less ten percent country's territory effectively local authority actively separated central authority regime. (2) Moderate fragmentation: Ten twenty-five percent country's territory effectively ruled local authority actively separated central authority regime. (3) Serious fragmentation: twenty-five percent (fifty percent) country's territory effectively ruled local authority actively separated central authority regime. democ Institutionalized democracy indicator, 0-10 scale. See PolityIV users' manual http://www.systemicpeace.org/inscr/p5manualv2018.pdf autoc Institutionalized autocracy indicator, 0-10 scale. See PolityIV users' manual http://www.systemicpeace.org/inscr/p5manualv2018.pdf polity Annual polity index (autoc - democ), including values interruption (-66), interregnum (-77), transition periods (-88). Higher values democratic. Note Polity users' manual (pp. 16-17) says "POLITY score added Polity IV data series recognition common usage users quantitative research overriding interest maintaining uniformity among users application. simple combination original DEMOC AUTOC index values unitary POLITY scale, many ways, runs contrary original theory stated Eckstein Gurr Patterns Authority (1975) , , treated interpreted due caution. primary utility investigative research augmented detailed analysis. original theory posits autocratic democratic authority distinct patterns authority, elements may co-exist particular regime context. inclusion variable data series seen acceptance counter-proposal autocracy democracy alternatives opposites unified authority spectrum, even though elements perspective may implied original theory. POLITY variable provides convenient avenue examining general regime effects analyses researchers note middle implied POLITY "spectrum" somewhat muddled terms original theory, masking various combinations DEMOC AUTOC scores POLITY score. Investigations involving hypotheses varying effects democracy /autocracy employ original Polity scheme test DEMOC AUTOC separately. polity2 Annual polity2 index, interpolating values interruption (-66 treated NA), interregnum *-77 treated 0), transition periods (prorated across transition). Higher values democratic. durable Regime durability. See PolityIV users' manual http://www.systemicpeace.org/inscr/p5manualv2018.pdf details. xrreg Regulation Chief Executive Recruitment. 1 = unregulated, 2 = designational/transitional, 3 = regulated. See PolityIV users' manual http://www.systemicpeace.org/inscr/p5manualv2018.pdf details. xrcomp Competitiveness Chief Executive Recruitment. 1 = selection, 2 = dual/transitional, 3 = election. See PolityIV users' manual http://www.systemicpeace.org/inscr/p5manualv2018.pdf details. xropen Openness Chief Executive Recruitment. 1 = unlimited, 2 = dual/transitional, 3 = election. See PolityIV users' manual http://www.systemicpeace.org/inscr/p5manualv2018.pdf details. xconst Executive constraints. 1 = closed, 2 = intermediate, 3 = slight moderate limitation, 4 = intermediate, 5 = substantial limitations, 6 = intermediate, 7 = executive parity subordination. See PolityIV users' manual http://www.systemicpeace.org/inscr/p5manualv2018.pdf details. parcomp Regulation participation. 0 = applicable, 1 = repressed, 2 = suppressed, 3 = factional, 4 = transitional, 5 = competitive. See PolityIV users' manual http://www.systemicpeace.org/inscr/p5manualv2018.pdf details. exrec Executive recruitment (concept). 1 = ascription, 2 = dual (ascription + designation), 3 = designation, 4 = Self selection, 5 = gradual transition self selection, 6 = dual (ascription + election), 7 = transitional restricted election, 8 = competitive election. See PolityIV users' manual http://www.systemicpeace.org/inscr/p5manualv2018.pdf details. exconst Executive constraints (concept). Identical xconst. 1 = closed, 2 = intermediate, 3 = slight moderate limitation, 4 = intermediate, 5 = substantial limitations, 6 = intermediate, 7 = executive parity subordination. See PolityIV users' manual http://www.systemicpeace.org/inscr/p5manualv2018.pdf details. polcomp Political competition (concept). 1 = suppressed, 2 = restricted 3 = Imposed transition, 4 = Uninstitutionalized, 5 = gradual transition uninstitutionalized, 6 = factional/restricted, 7 = factional, 8 = electoral transition: persistent conflict/coercion, 9 = electoral transition: limited conflict/coercion, 10 = institutionalized electoral. See PolityIV users' manual http://www.systemicpeace.org/inscr/p5manualv2018.pdf details. prior Regime Polity code immediately prior regime end date. polity users' manual (p. 31) says "PRIOR code may number -10 10 may "begin state" code (88 99); may standardized authority code (.e., -66, -77, -88) necessarily transitory conditions, polities. PRIOR code corresponding EYEAR EDATE initial polity change (.e., first year record) multi-year regime change repeated record final year multi-year change. done facilitate retrieval information concerning beginning ending polities multi-year regime changes, particularly D3 "flag" variable used select regime transition cases larger dataset." emonth Polity end month. End month previous polity, start current. eday Polity end day. End day previous polity, start current. eyear Polity end year. End year previous polity, start current. eprec End date precision. 1 = exact date, 2 = assigned date (one event used, event persisted one day), 3 = approximate date (month identified, day), 4 = missing (year identified, month day), 5 = unknown (recorded 1995-98). interim Polity users' manual says (p. 32) "Interim Polity Code: Interim Polity coding used denote (1) short-lived nature distinct change regime authority spans portion coded year (.e., POLITY code) otherwise recorded due annualized structure Polity data, (2) "transition" period three years less new Polity established (.e., -88 code), (3) "interruption" period length Polity remains foreign authority (.e., -66 code), (4) "interregnal" period denoting collapse central authority (.e., -77 code). INTERIM coded year end date (EDATE) previous Polity begin date (BDATE) subsequent Polity whenever standardized authority codes used series incremental changes period three years orless combine consistent POLITY change three points ("consistent" means incremental changes general direction, positive negative)." bmonth Polity beginning month. Beginning month next polity, end current. bday Polity beginning day. Beginning day next polity, end current. eyear Polity beginning year. Beginning year previous polity, end current. bprec Beginning date precision. 1 = exact date, 2 = assigned date (one event used, event persisted one day), 3 = approximate date (month identified, day), 4 = missing (year identified, month day), 5 = unknown (recorded 1995-98). post Regime polity code immediately current regime. change Net difference prior post. See PolityIV users' manual http://www.systemicpeace.org/inscr/p5manualv2018.pdf details. Note code 88 denotes "pre-existing polity" (polities existed 1800), 96 indicates state disintegration, 0 state transition, 97 state transformation, 98 state demise, 99 state creation. d4 Regime Transition Completed. Variable D4 flag variable designates (code "1") year regime change final year multi-year regime transition. sf State failure. Variable SF flag variable designates (code "1") every year Polity considered condition "complete collapse central authority" "state failure" (.e., -77). variable SF also coded "1" years state disintegrates (variable CHANGE code "96") profound revolutionary change political authority occurs (authority previous Polity assumed collapsed completely prior revolutionary seizure power subsequent restructuring authority). regtrans Regime transition. 3 = major democratic transition, 2 = minor democratic transition, 1 = positive regime change, 0 = little change, -1 = negative regime change, -2 adverse regime change, -77 state failure, -66 interruption, 96 = state disintegration, 97 = state transformation, 98 = state demise, 99 = state creation.

title: Democracy, Voice, and Accountability Index from the World Governance Indicators — download_wgi_voice_and_accountability
text: dataset containing country-year version latest update (2022) World Governance Indicators "Democracy, Voice Accountability" Index, compiled Daniel Kaufmann Aart Kraay. original data available http://www.govindicators.org, along full explanation methodology used compile index. According compilers, "Voice accountability captures perceptions extent country's citizens able participate selecting government, well freedom expression, freedom association, free media." wb_country Country name (World Bank standard). wb_code World bank 3 character country code. year Year. Estimate Estimate governance (ranges approximately -2.5 (weak) 2.5 (strong) governance performance), mean 0. StdErr Standard error reflects variability around point estimate governance. NumSrc Number data sources estimate based. methodology document lists, among , EIU Democracy Index, Freedom House, World Economic Forum Global Competitiveness Report, Gallup World Poll, Institutional Profiles Database, Political Risk Services International Country Risk Guide, Reporters Without Borders Press Freedom Index. See http://info.worldbank.org/governance/wgi/va.pdf details. Rank Percentile rank among countries (ranges 0 (lowest) 100 (highest) rank). Lower Lower bound 90% confidence interval governance, percentile rank terms. Upper Upper bound 90% confidence interval governance, percentile rank terms

title: Extended UDS — extended_uds
text: dataset contains extension Unified Democracy Scores Pemstein, Meserve, Melton (2010). PMM 2010 use latent variable approach combine diverse measurements democracy broad panel countries 1946 2012; dataset extends scores using democracy measures broader temporal spatial coverage, generating democracy scores 37738 country-years (277 distinct countries non-sovereign territories). generated function generate_extended_uds. measurement democracy complicated controversial. extended UDS makes judgments measures democracy used generate latent democracy scores, long used scholarly work. uses dichotomous, trichotomous, ordinal, continuous indices; indices focus primarily "competition" indices focus "participation" dimension democracy; "thick" indices attempt measure wide variety characteristics plausibly attributed democracy; "minimalist" indexes restrict bare minimum competition. Nevertheless, indexes agree democracy something competition participation, even weight dimensions somewhat differently, even include things, civil rights. latent variable score calculated using democracy measures following datasets: anckar, anrr, arat_pmm, blm, bmr (democracy_femalesuffrage indicator ), bnr_extended, bti, bollen_pmm, svmdi (continuous indicator), doorenspleet, eiu, fh (fh_total_reversed indicator), fh_electoral, gwf_all_extended, hadenius_pmm, kailitz (trichotomous indicator democracy, electoral autocracy middle category), LIED, magaloni_extended, mainwaring, munck_pmm, pacl, pacl_update, peps (PEPS1v indicator), pitf (non-binary indicator), polity (polity 2 indicator), polyarchy (contestation participation dimensions), polyarchy_dimensions (contestation participation dimensions), prc, REIGN, svolik, ulfelder_extended, utip (trichotomous indicator, one-party democracy middle category), v2x_polyarchy indicator vdem_simple, vanhanen (vanhanen_democratization indicator ), wgi, wahman_teorell_hadenius (regimenyrobust variable). Please refer documentation generate_democracy_scores_dataset details measures democracy, Marquez 2016 details construction extended latent variable model used generate scores.

title: Extended UDS — extended_uds
text: z1, z1_adj, z1_as_prob, z1_adj_as_prob latent democracy score. z1 "raw" (unadjusted) score, mean approximately 0 sd 1; z1_adj version adjusted 0 represents average cutpoint dichotomous indicators composing index; _as_prob versions adjust 0-1 range applying stats::pnorm (treating probability measures). se_z1 standard error score. _pct025, _pct975 latent democracy score 95% confidence intervals. num_measures number measures contributed index particular country-year. Varies 1 31; one can filter dataset include scores , say, 5 measures contributed index. measures names specific measures contributed index particular country-year. list-column; use tidyr::unnest unnest. See documentation generate_democracy_scores_dataset specific info particular measure.

title: Freedom House
text: pmm_country original country name PMM replication data. year calendar year. approximate. surveys cover specific periods original data always overlap single year. particular, year 1981 "skipped" – single survey covers Jan.1981 - Aug. 1982 value assigned 1982 . pmm_freedomhouse reversed measure political rights civil liberties, 1 7, higher values democratic (opposite actual FH data). fh_total_reversed reversed measure political rights civil liberties, 0 12, higher values democratic (opposite actual FH data). convert scale pmm_freedomhouse, divide two add 1, average pr cl reverse. pr political rights scores (1 7) archived Freedom House data (fh). cl civil rights scores (1 7) archived Freedom House data (fh). status status country archived Freedom House data (Free, Partly Free, Free). fh_total sum political rights civil liberties scores. Ranges 2 14.

title: Generate a data frame containing all the democracy measures accessible from this package — generate_democracy_scores_dataset
text: function automates process joining together archived downloadable datasets package, producing comprehensive data frame every democracy measure. automatically converts democracy measure numeric value, ensures larger values associated democracy, country-years appropriately matched.

title: Generate a data frame containing all the democracy measures accessible from this package — generate_democracy_scores_dataset
code: generate_democracy_scores_dataset(   datasets,   selection,   output_format = "long",   use_extended = TRUE,   verbose = TRUE,   force_redownload = FALSE,   scale_scores = FALSE,   keep_only_last_in_year = TRUE,   uds_release_year = c(2014, 2011, 2010),   svmdi_release_year = c(2020, 2016),   exclude_pmm_duplicates = TRUE,   prefer_successor = TRUE,   fix_PIPE = TRUE,   enforce_GW_enddates = FALSE )

title: Generate a data frame containing all the democracy measures accessible from this package — generate_democracy_scores_dataset
text: datasets Character vector indicating datasets use producing combined data frame. Can (unambiguous abbreviation ) "anckar", "anrr", "LIED", "PIPE", "arat_pmm", "blm", "blm_pmm", "bmr", "bnr", "bnr_extended", "bti", "bollen_pmm", "doorenspleet", "eiu", "fh_pmm", "gwf_all", "gwf_all_extended", "hadenius_pmm", "kailitz", "magaloni", "magaloni_extended", "mainwaring", "mainwaring_pmm", "munck_pmm", "pacl", "pacl_pmm", "pacl_update", "peps", "pitf", "polity_pmm", "polyarchy", "polyarchy_dimensions", "polyarchy_pmm", "prc_gasiorowski", "prc_pmm", "svmdi", "svolik_regime", "uds", "ulfelder", "ulfelder_extended", "utip", "vanhanen", "vdem", "wahman_teorell_hadenius", "reign" "REIGN", "polityIV", "polity5", "fh", "fh_electoral", "wgi". can also empty; default . selection regular expression selecting among datasets. Optional. output_format Character. Whether output "wide" (measure democracy separate column) "long" (column measure names, column values) version data frame. Default "long". use_extended Whether use "extended" (, including values 1945 regimes) versions datasets (gwf, ulfelder, bnr, magaloni). Default TRUE. verbose Provides running commentary function . Default TRUE. force_redownload Whether re-download datasets can re-downloaded, including archived package. Used debugging; default FALSE. scale_scores Whether scale measure (substracting mean dividing standard deviation). Default FALSE. keep_only_last_in_year Whether keep last regime measurement given country-year. datasets (e.g., prc, reign) contain one regime measurement per country-year cases (regime changed multiple times year); setting TRUE discards except regime measurement 31 December year, standard practice datasets. Default TRUE. setting interest set output_format = "long", since ignored output_format = "wide", automatically discards regime measurements except last year. uds_release_year release original uds dataset include. Defaults latest, 2014. Can 2014, 2011, 2010, . svmdi_release_year release svmdi dataset include. Defaults latest, 2020. Can 2020 2016, . exclude_pmm_duplicates Whether exclude versions measures found Pemstein, Meserve, Melton's replication dataset 2010 piece introducing Unified Democracy Scores (Pemstein, Meserve, Melton 2010, 2013). See blm_pmm, prc_pmm, fh_pmm, pacl_pmm, vanhanen_pmm, polity_pmm details. included mostly extend replicate uds scores. Default TRUE; set FALSE keep . prefer_successor cases (e.g., Italy 1861) datasets contain two measurements year: one precursor state (Piedmont-Sardinia, Italy/Sardinia extended_country_name) one successor state (unified Italy). problem affects following entities different datasets: Ethiopia (Eritrea split 1993); Germany (reunification 1993); Italy (unification 1861, previously Piedmont-Sardinia); Pakistan (Bangladesh split 1971); Soviet Union (creation 1922; dissolution 1991); Sudan (South Sudan split 2011); Vietnam (1945-1953 period reunification 1976); Yemen (unification 1990); Yugoslavia (1991 breakup). Setting prefer_successor TRUE ensures successor state measurement included, successor state preferentially state Gleditsch-Ward system. Setting FALSE ensures measurements included, results two measurements country-year (country means country extended_country_name). fix_PIPE PIPE dataset uses particularly tangled state system, measuring countries exist, splitting countries historical modern states measuring historical period: fixed setting prefer_successor TRUE (default) others make much sense. fix_PIPE = TRUE (default) deletes Austria-Hungary entirely (principled choice half retain); removes Czech Republic period 1990-1992; removes North South Korea 19th century; assumes Pakistan 1950-1970 must include Bangladesh, Turkey 1820-1913 refers Ottoman Empire; removes unified Vietnam period 1954-1975, Serbia 1990, Serbia Montenegro 1990 1991 (leaving Yugoslabia 1990 1991). enforce_GW_enddates enforces Gleditsch-Ward enddates historical states, measured dissolution. affects limited number entities: Tibet (ends 1950), Czechoslovakia (ends 1992), Gran Colombia (ends 1831; Polity measures 1832), Vatican (identified Papal States, ends 1870) Zanzibar (ends 1964). default FALSE.
